title: Unexpected panic when building code using interpolate_idents
body:
I'm not exactly sure what is causing the problem but the initial [poc](https://github.com/rust-av/rust-av/commit/0eeaf58a39b2cf69bf67090e5a37a79928d23eea) has no problems while [extending](https://github.com/rust-av/rust-av/commit/c42516d74465e556a37cdb21bea01d94d0c8e801) the macro triggers the following panic:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "expected type, found `->`"', ../src/libcore/result.rs:788
```

> rustc 1.12.0-nightly (936bfea94 2016-07-20)
